intro: Senecio tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow to white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
